solution_line_template: When she picks {first_pick_fraction} of the number of tomatoes, she goes home with {first_pick_fraction}*{initial_tomatoes} = <<{first_pick_fraction}*{initial_tomatoes}={first_pick_amount}>>{first_pick_amount} tomatoes.
The total number of tomatoes remaining will be {initial_tomatoes}-{first_pick_amount} = <<{initial_tomatoes}-{first_pick_amount}={remaining_after_first_pick}>>{remaining_after_first_pick} tomatoes.

After picking {second_pick_amount} more tomatoes the following week, the number of tomatoes remaining is {remaining_after_first_pick}-{second_pick_amount} = <<{remaining_after_first_pick}-{second_pick_amount}={remaining_after_second_pick}>>{remaining_after_second_pick} tomatoes.

The next week she picks twice the number she picked the previous week, that is {second_pick_amount}*{twice_factor} = <<{second_pick_amount}*{twice_factor}={third_pick_amount}>>{third_pick_amount} tomatoes.

The total number of tomatoes remaining after the final picking is {remaining_after_second_pick}-{third_pick_amount} = <<{remaining_after_second_pick}-{third_pick_amount}={final_remaining_tomatoes}>>{final_remaining_tomatoes} tomatoes.
